responses: Hello! I am HealthBot (Created by Joven & Fuerzas). I can help with Sickness, Diet, First Aid, and General Health.
You're welcome! Stay healthy and drink water!
Goodbye! Don't forget to drink 8 glasses of water today.
I was developed by the brilliant team of Joven Dolindo and Fuerzas.
I understand you are in pain. Can you tell me WHERE it hurts? (e.g., Head, Stomach, Back, Tooth)
Headache Relief: 1. Drink water (dehydration causes headaches). 2. Rest in a dark, quiet room. 3. Take Paracetamol/Biogesic if needed.
Stomach Pain: Avoid spicy/oily foods. Drink ginger tea or warm water. If pain is severe or right-sided, consult a doctor.
Toothache: Rinse mouth with warm salt water. Apply a cold compress to the cheek. Take pain relievers and see a dentist ASAP.
Flu Advice: 1. Rest completely. 2. Drink lots of water/Gatorade. 3. Take Paracetamol for fever every 4 hours. If fever lasts >3 days, see a doctor.
Cold Relief: Stay hydrated, use a saline nasal spray, and rest. Steam inhalation (tuob) helps clear the nose.
Cough Remedy: Drink warm calamansi or lemon water with honey. Avoid cold drinks/sweets. If cough lasts >1 week, consult a doctor.
Sore Throat Relief: Gargle with warm salt water (1 tsp salt in 1 cup water). Drink warm tea with honey.
Diarrhea Advice: The most important thing is HYDRATION. Drink Oresol or Gatorade. Eat bananas and toast. Avoid milk.
Back Pain: Improve your posture. Don't sit for too long. Apply a hot compress for muscle relaxation or cold compress for inflammation.
Leg Cramps: Stretch the muscle gently. Massage the area. Eat potassium-rich foods like Bananas and drink water.
Sleep Tips: 1. No phone 1 hour before bed (blue light keeps you awake). 2. Drink warm milk or chamomile tea. 3. Try 4-7-8 breathing.
Stress Management: Take a deep breath. Take a 10-minute walk. Talk to a friend. Remember, it's okay to take a break.
General Diet: Eat more vegetables/fruits. Avoid processed foods and sugary drinks. Use the 'Pinggang Pinoy' guide (half plate veggies/fruit).
Weight Loss: create a 'Calorie Deficit' (eat less than you burn). Avoid rice/sweets at night. Do cardio exercises (jogging/walking).
Weight Gain: Eat calorie-dense healthy foods like eggs, nuts, avocados, and meat. Eat more frequently (5-6 times a day).
Acne Care: 1. Wash face twice daily. 2. DO NOT pop pimples (it causes scars). 3. Change pillowcases often. 4. Avoid oily foods.
Dandruff: Use an anti-dandruff shampoo containing Zinc or Salicylic acid. Avoid scratching your scalp.
Bad Breath: Brush your teeth AND your tongue. Floss daily. Drink plenty of water to avoid dry mouth.
First Aid for Burns: Run COOL tap water over the burn for 10-15 minutes. Do NOT put ice or toothpaste. Apply aloe vera if available.
First Aid for Cuts: 1. Wash with soap and water. 2. Apply pressure to stop bleeding. 3. Apply betadine/ointment and cover with a bandage.
Nosebleed: Lean slightly FORWARD (not back). Pinch the soft part of your nose for 10 minutes. Breathe through your mouth.
Animal Bite: Wash the wound thoroughly with soap and water for 15 minutes. Go to a hospital/animal bite center IMMEDIATELY for shots.
High Blood Pressure: Reduce salt intake (iwas maalat). Avoid fatty meat. Take your maintenance medicine if prescribed.
Diabetes Care: Avoid sugary drinks (softdrinks/iced tea). Eat brown rice instead of white. Monitor your blood sugar regularly.
Dengue Watch: Watch for high fever, rashes, and pain behind eyes. If gums bleed, go to the hospital immediately.
Panic Attack Aid: 1. Sit down. 2. Follow the 3-3-3 rule: Look at 3 things, listen to 3 sounds, move 3 body parts. 3. Breathe slowly.
I hear you. You are not alone. Please reach out to a friend, family member, or a professional. Mental health is just as important as physical health.
Asthma Attack: Sit upright (do not lie down). Use your inhaler immediately (1 puff every minute for 10 puffs). If it doesn't help, call for emergency help.
CRITICAL WARNING: If you have severe chest pressure spreading to the jaw/arm, shortness of breath, and cold sweat, CALL AN AMBULANCE immediately.
Stroke Signs (FAST): Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call emergency. Rush to the hospital immediately.
UTI Advice: Drink plenty of water and Cranberry juice. Avoid holding your pee. If there is blood or fever, consult a doctor for antibiotics.
Kidney Stones: Stay hydrated. Limit salt and animal protein. Severe pain with nausea requires immediate medical attention.
Gout Management: Avoid high-purine foods like beans (monggo), red meat, shellfish, and alcohol. Drink plenty of water.
Anemia Tips: Eat iron-rich foods like leafy greens (malunggay), red meat, liver, and beans. Take Vitamin C to help absorb iron.
Vertigo Relief: Sit or lie down immediately. Avoid sudden head movements. Stare at a fixed object. Ginger tea may help with nausea.
Chickenpox: Isolate to prevent spreading. Do not scratch blisters. Take oatmeal baths for itching. Use Paracetamol for fever (NOT Aspirin).
Measles: Requires isolation. Stay hydrated. Vitamin A supplements are often recommended. Watch out for high fever and breathing problems.
Constipation Relief: Eat high-fiber foods (Papaya, Oatmeal, Vegetables). Drink warm water in the morning. Move and exercise.
Hemorrhoids: Eat fiber to soften stool. Do sitz baths (warm water soak). Avoid straining when using the toilet.
Ulcer/Gastritis: Eat small, frequent meals. Avoid coffee, alcohol, spicy foods, and painkillers like ibuprofen on an empty stomach.
Sore Eyes: Highly contagious! Wash hands frequently. Do not share towels. Apply a warm compress. If vision is affected, see a doctor.
Ear Pain: Keep the ear dry. Do not insert cotton buds. Use a warm compress outside the ear. If there is discharge, see a doctor.
Dehydration: Drink water or electrolyte drinks (Oresol/Gatorade) immediately. Signs of severe dehydration include confusion and no urine.
Food Poisoning: Rest your stomach for a few hours. Sip small amounts of water or electrolytes. Avoid solid foods until vomiting stops.
Heat Stroke: Move to a cool place immediately. Remove excess clothing. Cool the body with water/ice packs. This is a medical emergency.
PCOS: Maintain a healthy weight through diet and exercise. Limit carbs and sugar. Consult an OB-GYN for hormonal management.
Period Pain: Use a hot water bag on your lower tummy. Drink warm water. Avoid caffeine and salty foods.
Early Pregnancy Signs: Missed period, nausea (morning sickness), breast tenderness, and frequent urination. Take a test to be sure.
Vitamins: Vit C for immunity, Vit D for bones, Iron for blood, Vit B for energy/nerves. Always eat fruits/veggies first before supplements.
Hair Loss: Can be caused by stress, genetics, or diet. Eat protein and iron. Use mild shampoo. Avoid tight hairstyles.
Eczema: Keep skin moisturized (use lotion/petroleum jelly). Avoid harsh soaps with fragrance. Avoid scratching.
Ringworm: Keep the area dry. Use antifungal cream (like Ketoconazole) regularly for 2-4 weeks. Do not share towels.
Hangover Cure: Drink lots of water to rehydrate. Eat a good meal with carbs. Sleep it off. Avoid 'hair of the dog' (drinking more).
Motion Sickness: Look at the horizon (don't look at your phone). Sit in the front seat. Chew ginger candy or take Bonamine before travel.
Appendicitis Warning: Sharp pain on the lower RIGHT side of the stomach, especially if it gets worse when moving/coughing. Go to the ER immediately.
CPR Guide: 1. Call for help/ambulance. 2. Push hard and fast in the center of the chest (100-120 beats per minute). 3. Continue until help arrives.
Choking First Aid: Perform the Heimlich Maneuver. Stand behind them, wrap arms around waist, and make a fist above the navel. Thrust IN and UP hard.
Fainting First Aid: Lay the person flat on their back. Elevate their legs higher than their heart. Loosen tight clothing. Do not give water until fully awake.
Tetanus Warning: If punctured by a rusty or dirty object, clean the wound immediately. Go to a health center for a Tetanus Toxoid injection within 24 hours.
Stye (Kuliti): Do NOT pop it. Apply a warm compress (warm towel) for 10-15 minutes, 3 times a day. It usually drains on its own.
Hiccup Cure: Hold your breath for 10 seconds. Drink a glass of cold water quickly. Swallow a teaspoon of sugar.
Keto Diet: A low-carb, high-fat diet. You eat meat, fish, eggs, and healthy oils, but avoid rice, bread, and sugar. Consult a doctor before starting.
Intermittent Fasting (IF): A pattern of eating. Common is 16:8 (Fast for 16 hours, eat within an 8-hour window). Helps with weight loss and insulin sensitivity.
Quit Smoking: Smoking causes lung cancer and heart disease. Try nicotine gum/patches. Your lungs start repairing themselves 20 minutes after you quit.
Alcohol Advice: Limit intake. Excessive drinking damages the liver (Cirrhosis). Men: max 2 drinks/day. Women: max 1 drink/day.
Body Odor: Shower daily with antibacterial soap. Use antiperspirant/deodorant. Wear breathable fabrics like cotton. Wash clothes thoroughly.
Sleep Paralysis (Bangungot): It happens when your mind wakes up but your body is still asleep. It is scary but usually harmless. Try to wiggle your toes to wake up.
Myth Buster: Sleeping with wet hair DOES NOT cause blindness or insanity. However, it can cause hair breakage or fungal infections on the pillow.
Myth Buster: Cracking your knuckles DOES NOT cause arthritis. The sound is just gas bubbles popping in the fluid between joints.
Medical Fact: 'Pasma' is not a medical term. Hand tremors or sweating can be caused by tired muscles, nerves, or thyroid issues. Rest usually helps.
Caffeine: Good for energy but too much causes palpitations and anxiety. Limit to 400mg (approx 4 cups) per day.
Digital Eye Strain: Follow the 20-20-20 rule. Every 20 minutes, look at something 20 feet away for 20 seconds to rest your eyes.
Lower Cholesterol: Reduce saturated fats (fried chicken, pork fat). Eat more fiber (oatmeal, beans). Exercise regularly.
Sunburn Relief: Take a cool shower. Apply Aloe Vera gel or moisturizing lotion. Drink water. Do not peel the loose skin.
Head Lice (Kuto): Use a medicated shampoo (Permethrin). Use a fine-tooth comb (suyod). Wash all beddings in hot water.
Athlete's Foot: Keep feet dry. Change socks daily. Use antifungal powder or cream. Don't walk barefoot in public showers.
Scabies: Caused by mites. It is very contagious. You need a prescription cream (Permethrin) from a doctor. Wash all clothes in hot water.
Boil (Pigsa): Apply warm compress to help it drain. Do NOT squeeze or pop it (infection might spread). If it's big or you have a fever, see a doctor.
Mouth Sore (Singaw): Avoid spicy/salty foods. Gargle with warm salt water. Apply over-the-counter gels for pain relief.
Blisters: Do not pop them to prevent infection. Cover with a bandage. If it pops, clean with soap and water and apply antibiotic ointment.
Snoring Tips: Sleep on your SIDE, not your back. Maintain a healthy weight. Avoid alcohol before bed. Elevate your head with pillows.
Heat Rash (Bungang Araw): Keep the area cool and dry. Wear loose cotton clothes. Apply baby powder or calamine lotion to soothe itching.
Varicose Veins: Elevate your legs when resting. Avoid standing or sitting for too long. Wear compression stockings if recommended by a doctor.
Stiff Neck: Use a hot compress to relax muscles. Gently stretch your neck side to side. Check your pillow height (it might be too high).
Ingrown Nail: Soak foot in warm salt water for 15 mins. Do not cut the nail too short or curved. If infected (pus/nana), see a doctor.
Eye Twitching: Usually caused by stress, lack of sleep, or too much caffeine. Rest your eyes and sleep more. It is NOT a superstitious sign.
Dry Eyes: Blink more often when using computers. Use lubricating eye drops (artificial tears). Stay hydrated.
Object in Eye (Puwing): Do NOT rub your eye! Blink rapidly to produce tears. Flush eye with clean water. If it doesn't come out, go to the ER.
Splinter (Salubsob): Wash hands. Sterilize tweezers with alcohol. Gently pull the splinter out in the same direction it entered. Clean with soap.
Callus (Kalyo): Soak feet in warm water. Use a pumice stone to gently scrub dead skin. Apply moisturizer daily.
Lost Voice (Paos): Rest your voice (don't whisper, just stay quiet). Drink plenty of warm water. Avoid cold drinks and sweets.
Bloating: Eat slowly and chew food well. Avoid carbonated drinks (softdrinks) and chewing gum. Ginger tea helps relieve gas.
Underarm Care: Avoid tight clothes. Use mild, alcohol-free deodorants. Exfoliate gently. Home remedy: Rub lemon/calamansi (cautiously) and rinse.
Stretch Marks: Keep skin hydrated with cocoa butter or Vitamin E oil. They are natural and fade over time, but hard to remove completely without laser.
Vitamin Timing: Multivitamins and Vitamin B are best taken in the MORNING (for energy). Magnesium is good at NIGHT (for sleep). Always take with food.
Probiotics: Good for digestion and immunity. Found in Yogurt, Yakult, Kimchi, and Miso. Helps prevent diarrhea and bloating.
Cracked Heels: Scrub gently with a stone. Apply thick moisturizer or petroleum jelly before bed and wear socks overnight.
Blocked Nose: Steam inhalation (Tuob). Keep your head elevated when sleeping. Spicy food might help clear sinuses temporarily.
Oily Face Tips: Wash face morning and night (don't over-wash). Use oil-free or water-based moisturizers. Use blotting paper during the day.
Dark Circles: Sleep at least 7-8 hours. Place cold cucumber slices or cold spoons on eyes to reduce puffiness. Stay hydrated.
Abs Tips: 1. Planks (30 seconds). 2. Crunches. 3. Leg raises. Remember: 'Abs are made in the kitchen'â€”reduce sugar and fried foods.
Best Cardio: Jogging, Swimming, and Jumping Rope burn the most calories. Aim for at least 30 minutes, 3-4 times a week.
Yoga Benefits: Improves flexibility, reduces stress, and strengthens muscles. Try 'Child's Pose' for relaxation.
DOMS (Muscle Soreness): It's normal after exercise. Rest, hydrate, and do light stretching. It usually goes away in 2-3 days.
Ginger Benefits: Great for sore throat (salabat), nausea/vomiting, and relieving stomach gas. It is natural and safe.
Turmeric: A strong anti-inflammatory. Good for arthritis and joint pain. Often drunk as tea with honey.
Eggs: They are a 'Superfood'. High in protein and vitamins. 1-2 eggs a day is generally safe for most people.
Chocolate: DARK chocolate (70% cocoa) is healthy and good for the heart in small amounts. Milk chocolate has too much sugar.
Rice Alternatives: Brown rice (more fiber), Corn (low glycemic index), Quinoa, or Sweet Potato (Kamote).
Baby Fever: Do NOT give Aspirin. Use Paracetamol drops (prescribed by pedia). Do a sponge bath with lukewarm water. Breastfeed frequently.
Diaper Rash: Change diapers frequently. Keep the area dry. Apply petroleum jelly or zinc oxide cream. Air dry the baby's skin.
Teething: Massage gums with a clean finger. Give a cold (not frozen) teething ring. Wipe drool to prevent rashes.
Breastfeeding: Best for baby's immunity. To increase milk: Drink malunggay soup, stay hydrated, and nurse often (latch creates supply).
Anti-Rabies: It is LIFE SAVING. You typically need 3-4 doses (Day 0, 3, 7, and sometimes 14/28). Never skip a dose.
TB Signs: Cough lasting >2 weeks, weight loss, night sweats. TB is curable with 6 months of continuous medication. Go to a Brgy Health Center.
Pneumonia: High fever, chills, and difficulty breathing. Requires antibiotics. Very dangerous for kids and seniors.
Typhoid: Caused by dirty food/water. Symptoms: High fever, headache, stomach pain. Prevention: Wash hands and boil drinking water.
Malaria: Spread by mosquitoes (mostly at night/mountains). Symptoms: Cycles of extreme cold chills and high fever. Use mosquito nets.
Kidney Care: 1. Drink enough water. 2. Limit salty foods (noodles, chips, patis). 3. Don't hold your pee. 4. Control blood sugar.
